info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 10:47PM CDT until July 23 at 1:49AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Mulberry Creek Near Salina affecting Saline County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mulberry Creek near Salina.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning to early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Agricultural flooding can be expected. Parts of Halstead Road near the river gage site, which is west of Salina, will begin to take on water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 25.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
